intro: Dimorphanthera inopinata, commonly known as the black-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and distinctive black flowers. The plant attaches itself to the branches of its host trees, drawing water and nutrients through its haustoria. It produces small, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. Due to its limited distribution and specialized ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
